title: Edit booking: Conflicts in past occurrences

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
When editing booking (only dates), conflicts with past occurrences show up.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create recurrent booking that starts in the past and ends in the future
2. Cancel one of the past occurrences
3. Create a single booking when the occurrence in step 2 was
4. Edit the recurrent booking so the end date is later in the future
5. A conflict shows up where the cancelled occurrence was, in the past date of the _Booking after changes_ calendar

**Expected behavior**
Edit should happen without any conflict.

**Screenshots**
Take into account the date this issue was created (21/06/2019) as it's the date this screenshot was taken and it's relevant to understand the result.
![Screenshot from 2019-06-21 17-07-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8863238/59932417-66374d80-9447-11e9-9373-e6892cc8ebcd.png)

title: Ambiguous "Email" action
body:
**Describe the bug**
The first entry in the 'Actions' menu in the 'Registration' page is labelled 'Email' while it's used to send email to participants. As far as I can say, even if the context helps, this is a bit weird in English.

However, it's really weird in French (I mainly use this language) where it says "Adresse électronique", literally "email address" (singular). According to my Italian and Spanish colleagues, the respective translation in those languages are weird too.

Note that this is not just a purist issue: this weird phrasing makes hard to find the feature.

I have attached screenshots for those languages (and suggestions below).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Registration'
2. Click on a registration list
3. Select one or more participants
4. Click on 'Actions'
5. See the first entry

**Expected behavior**

From my understanding and discussion with my colleagues, I would say:
- in English: "Send email"
- in French: "Envoyer un courrier électronique" (to stay coherent with other usages)
- in Italian: "Inviare une email"
- in Spanish: "Enviar un correo electrónico"

Other entries in the 'Action' menu have similar structure.

**Screenshots**

English:
![en](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/ac3537d3-22cb-4e99-8e25-57786cce8cf2)

French:
![fr](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/75d2e99d-0303-45e7-b38e-c0a84cd660b5)

Italian:
![it](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/0ca706d7-3443-4a0b-adad-04945fb722f9)

Spanish:
![es](https://github.com/indico/indico/assets/4348913/11c6943b-ca4d-4cb1-a1a2-e2d6380af03c)

**Additional context**

I don't know much about translations but AFAIK this entry use the "Email" message which is used in several files. Maybe we need to differentiate the email address and the action of sending an email.

Note that there is a "Send emails" message which is almost what we need.

title: All attachments deleted in abstract when you want to delete only one
body:
With an abstract with several attached file.

On the edit page, I click on the red cross to delete a file. This file disappear from the list.
Then I click on the submit button. Now all the attachment of the abstract are deleted, not only the one I clicked

title: Plugin badges broken if there's a long word in the plugin name
body:
E.g. a plugin named "Webcast/Recording Request". "Webcast/Recording" is considered one word so it's not wrapped.

One solution would be using `text-overflow: ellipsis` and showing the full title in a tooltip. Another one would be using `word-wrap: break-word` but that looks quite ugly since there's no hyphenation.

title: [A11Y] Timezone list markup improvements
body:
**Describe the bug**

Timezone selector's behavior currently suffers from several issues related to keyboard interaction. It could also use some UX improvements as well.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Scenario A:

1. Go to any page which has a time zone selector
2. Focus the timezone button using a keyboard
3. Open the timezone popup by pressing Enter/Return or Spacebar
4. Try to navigate into the timezone popup
5. Observe that navigation "skips" the timezone popup

Scenario B:

1. Click at the top of the timezone popup so that further keyboard navigation will start from the top of the popup
2. Focus the radios
3. Select the "Specify a timezone" radio
4. Observe that the focus is automatically moved to the select list below

**Expected behavior**

When the popup is expanded, the keyboard focus should move to the popup *when the user presses Tab key* (not automatically).

When the "Specify a timezone" radio is selected, focus should *not* automatically move to the select list.

There are also several issues with the semantics of the markup which I will address in a patch for this issue.

**Additional context**

- https://talk.getindico.io/t/keyboard-navigation-session-bar-timezone-picker/3197/3
- https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/keyboard.html

title: Fix positioning style
body: For some unknown reason, dvw/dvh units didn't quite work... err... 100% in some cases. Using 100% instead appears to work well in the cases we have. It's difficult to tell if this is going to have any undesirable side-effects, but we can probably address that as it crops up. This issue was discovered in the time picker PR, but I've separated it here as I might need to adjust things in the other PRs after this lands.

title: Adding new regform field ignores field type
body:
Easy to reproduce: Add a registration form field, then close the dialog, and try adding another field - it will use the type you clicked the first time no matter what you select.

If you actually add the field, then the next time you try adding a field you get the type you selected the previous time.

SNOW ticket: `INC1488070`

title: Non bookable periods are not displayed nor checked on the view
body:
Non bookable periods are similar to blockings as they prevent reservations to be created. However, we don't display them in any calendar view nor do any check for them during the reservation workflow. This leads to people trying to book rooms that are not bookable and then getting an error in the last step because no occurrences could be created for that day without giving any particular reason as to why.

We should:
- [x] Add visual feedback in the calendar view (similar to blockings maybe?)
- [x] Prevent people to go past the second step of the reservation workflow
## Screenshots

The room is unavailable for that day but it show up normally. The green bar can be clicked and brings you to the next page. 

![screenshot from 2015-01-13 10 44 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718797/da52b4a4-9b11-11e4-8b82-e8f0e8de1988.png)

On the next page, one can try to pre/book and the error dialog pops up when the server creates no occurrences for the reservation.

![unnamed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/716307/5718807/fc11abcc-9b11-11e4-85a1-5469314f35c2.png)

title: Download button in file previewer doesn't download file in Firefox

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

```
Hello,

We print out a lot of posters on Indico. I have tried using the new 
version, and the posters seem to be cut off. The paper sizes are only A0, A1, A2, A3, A5 and letter (I would also suggest putting the 
default as A4, rather than A0) so that it corresponds to the templates that are on there from the older version.

Would it be possible to work on this so that the posters come out with  the correct size, dimensions as before?

Otherwise, so far, it seems quite pleasant to work with. Thank you.

Kind regards,

Michelle.
```

title: "Copy link" doesn't work after uploading an image
body:
When uploading images via the event image uploader we reload the image list with AJAX. The clipboard JS only runs once on dom ready though so clicking the link button will just open the image instead of copying the link to the clipboard.

Possible solutions:
- trigger indico:htmlUpdated and listen to that event in the clipboard code and apply the clipboard logic on elements where that event is triggered
- check whether we can tell the clipboard library to create a delegate on the document itself so it works with new elements. (maybe ask the developer of it in a github issue in their repo)

title: Free Text (Label) in Registration not shown in Modification
body: **Describe the bug** When placing a label (free text) in a registration form it is only shown at the registration itself, but when I want to modify the registration, I do not see the label. Likely this bug has appeared in 2.1.x, because I am almost certain that in 2.0.x it worked. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Create an event and a registration form 2. Add a "free text" aka label field to it 3. Open up the registration and register (you will see that your label is there) 4. Modify the registration afterwards (no label there) I also checked it on the sandbox.getindico.io **Expected behavior** I expect the label to be also present when being in modification mode. The whole point of it is to allow resubmitting information as a registrant, therefore I do not only need the modifiable fields but also the labels that have some reason to be there (e.g. stating "please only choose type x, when you are under 18...) **Screenshots**

title: Names of pending people appearing in some views of the event

milestone.title: v2.2
milestone.description: A rewrite of the Room Booking Module UI, which will allow us to stop depending on Mako and remove a good amount of legacy JS code. We'll be introducing React, Redux and Semantic UI React.

body:
**Describe the bug**
I created an event (a conference) and I have some people whose registration is still pending, thus they do not appear in the participant list. Nevertheless, I can read their names in some version of the event, e.g. using the "Indico style" theme.

**To Reproduce**
The event is the following: https://agenda.infn.it/event/18661/
The issue appears in the following ways:
- changing the theme of the event ("Change theme" button in the top-left corner), e.g. to the "Indico style" (https://agenda.infn.it/event/18661/timetable/?view=standard);
- in the page https://agenda.infn.it/event/18661/timetable/?print=1&view=standard which appears as a result searching on Google for the event;
- in the timetable page when the manager of the event chooses some of the themes for it, like the "Indico style".

**Expected behavior**
The names of the pending people should not appear anywhere.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/179599/45020675-e7942f80-b02f-11e8-8f81-058f551b0443.png)


This happens only if at least one participant is registered (so the registration indicator icon shows up)

title: Translation of "Select a category" dialog (missing "{0} categories" string from Transifex)
body:
In the "Select a category" dialog (e.g. "Create meeting" from the menu -> press "Choose category" button) the popup text, which appears when a mouse pointer is hovered over the number of categories and events on the right hand side of each row in the dialog, is **partially translated**. The text is "{0} categories | {0} events" with numbers inserted instead of "{0}" and single or plural form of the word "category"/"event" used.

The problem is that the "{0} events" part of that string is properly translated, while the "{0} categories" always stays in English.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to "Create meeting" in the main menu
2. Click on "Choose category" button
3. Hover mouse pointer over the numbers on the right hand side of any row in the dialog
4. See mixed-language text in the popup (see the screenshot for reference)

Or just search for `"{0} categories"` on Transifex and see that it is missing.

**Expected behavior**
The text of the popup should be fully translated.

**Screenshots**
German translation is used because on Transifex it is 100% translated, so no English words should be present (in theory)
![2024-12-01_21-33-52](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a75c2da9-ed9c-4b33-8d3a-22f4dc606486)

**Additional context**
 I assume that the code is located here: [indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js](https://github.com/indico/indico/blob/4fa81c297f4c08d5b842e420a26125627c5bc4cd/indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js#L300). So the issue might be with `indico/web/client/js/jquery/widgets/categorynavigator.js` missing from Transifex. The "{0} events" substring is present in Transifex as it appears also in `indico/modules/categories/client/js/display.js`, but the "{0} categories" substring seems to be unique to `categorynavigator.js`.

title: Check `.infoline i` CSS rule usage
body:
This completely breaks the looks when using italic text (CKEditor5 uses `<i>` instead of `<em>` 😠).

Maybe the rule is too generic and only needs to be applied to `i.icon-...`?

title: [A11Y] Registration form fields are not associated with the respective labels
body:
**Describe the bug**

The form fields on the registration page are not associated with the respective labels. This includes (but not limited to):

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a registration form using a screen reader
2. Focus any control
3. Observe that the field name is not announced

**Expected behavior**

The field name is announced.

**Additional context**

https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/labels-or-instructions.html

title: Impossible to get rid of room/location

milestone.title: v1.9
milestone.description:
Internal release that will include:

* Room Booking Module migrated to new RDBMS.
* New Whoosh Indexer for Category and Event names.

body:
``` yaml
# Ticket imported from Trac
```

Steps to reproduce:
- Create a contribution
- Edit it, unchecking "inherit from parent" and leaving the fields "room" and "location" blank,
- You will notice the location will remain

This seems to be a problem with the widget itself, which sends the room as an empty string instead of `null` (?)

title: FinalDropDown is not usable on iOS
body:
**Describe the bug**
The FinalDropDown element is not usable on iOS as when clicking it the system "zooms in" and the dropdown moves out of position.

**To Reproduce**
1. use an iOS device (I'm using an iPhone 15 Pro Max)
2. use a form containing one or more FinalDropDown
3. click in a FinalDropDown
4. try to select a value

**Expected behavior**
The values are visible and selectable

**Screenshots**
First test with Chrome:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f2c7c023-44dc-4382-8086-5ca62fc30eea)

Second test with Safari:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0446c39b-5c96-438c-b6de-ea6651e71484)

**Additional context**
Demo: https://sandbox.getindico.io/event/4757/
